meanings.definition: The action of subjecting someone or something to a particular experience or treatment.
meanings.sent1: The subjections of the students to rigorous testing caused stress and anxiety.
meanings.sent2: The subjections of animals to scientific experiments must be ethical and humane.
meanings.sent3: The subjections of the vegetables to the boiling water turned them into a delicious soup.
meanings.sent4: The subjections of the old building to harsh weather revealed its structural weaknesses.
meanings.sent5: The subjections of the delicate fabric to rough handling resulted in tears and frays.

meanings.definition: The state of being subject to something.
meanings.sent1: The subjections of the workers to long hours led to exhaustion and burnout.
meanings.sent2: The subjections of the town to frequent flooding required better drainage systems.
meanings.sent3: The subjections of the cat to endless cuddles made it purr contentedly.
meanings.sent4: The subjections of the mind to constant distractions hindered focus and productivity.
meanings.sent5: The subjections of the plant to direct sunlight caused it to thrive and grow.
